derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : via Old French from Latin argumentatio(n-), from argumentat- 'conducted as an argument', from argumentari

entry.def: Argumentation is the process of arguing in an organized or logical way, for example in philosophy.

means.word_mean: 1. a discussion in which reasons are advanced for and against some proposition or proposal;

sentences.sentence: "the argument over foreign aid goes on and on"

means.word_mean: 2. the methodical process of logical reasoning;

sentences.sentence: "I can't follow your line of reasoning"
